About HEART

HEART (Health Equity Advocacy Response Team) is a student-led organization dedicated to advancing health equity by addressing systemic, social, and economic barriers that prevent individuals and communities from achieving optimal health.

Our Vision

A world where every individual—regardless of background—has equal opportunity to achieve optimal health.

Our Mission

Advocate, educate, and act in response to health inequities through community-centered initiatives.

What is Health Equity?

Ensuring everyone has a fair and just opportunity to be as healthy as possible by removing barriers.

Barriers we address: poverty, discrimination, access gaps, language barriers, educational gaps, and more.

Join HEART View events

Our Values

Equity

Fairness and justice in access to health resources, education, and care.

Inclusion

Respect for all identities, backgrounds, and lived experiences.

Integrity

Ethical, evidence-based action and responsible community partnerships.

Collaboration

Working with communities, not over them—listening first, acting with care.

HEART

Health Equity Advocacy Response Team — a York University student-led group advancing health equity through advocacy, education, outreach, and community action.

This is a student-led website and is not an official York University website.
